metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5625 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.7.14 and earlier allows local users to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via vectors related to Server: Packaging.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.15-0ubuntu2').
